column1: Our work for Oklahoma’s Fifth District is not over.

We changed minds and built a movement of support in a district that pundits thought was unwinnable. When many voters in this district had lost faith that their vote counted for something we gave them hope. That’s a victory in itself.

Thank you to all of the staff volunteers and supporters who put their hearts into this campaign. We made a difference by talking with Oklahomans at the doors and on the phones about the issues important to our state.

The future of our communities is at stake. Those are things worth fighting for and I will not give up that fight. Not when we have so much work to do to give our families our workers and all Oklahomans a better life and a better shot at success.

Oklahoma’s Fifth District doesn’t belong to a party it belongs to the people. Oklahomans showed up yesterday to make their voices heard because there is so much at stake this election. Our health care is at stake. Our public schools are at stake.
Due to COVID we are hosting our watch party virtually this year. Join us to watch the election results roll in on Facebook Live at 7:45 PM! https://t.co/XPKOjfbCBJ

On Election Day today I’m thinking about my dear friend John Lewis and all the good trouble he caused in order to get us here today. For him and for us all let’s make it count. https://t.co/GSAN5IeVsE

Election Day is here!! Remember:  1. Despite power outages voting WILL continue as scheduled at all polling places 2. As long as you're IN LINE by 7 PM you’ll be able to vote 3. Bring a photo ID 4. Call us at 405-367-6054 if you need help  More info⬇️ https://t.co/gPvN0BU5iu

Look who I ran into last night! Last month we almost lost violinist Angelica Pereira. Despite having immigrated to our country perfectly legally she was initially denied her visa reauthorization. Angelica’s talent is a treasure and I’m so thrilled that I could help her stay. https://t.co/2ms2ag7c83
53 town halls and counting... https://t.co/PNZn35gJgi

💪 Team Horn getting in our arm workout for the day! Today we visited the Wildewood Baptist Church where fallen limbs from the ice storm were blocking access to the polling location. Doing our part to make sure ALL Oklahomans can exercise their right to vote! https://t.co/NeKcPe4D1T

On the move meeting voters and furry friends this morning in #OK05! Talking to voters at the door is one of my favorite parts of campaigning. Thank you to all our amazing volunteers who have signed up to knock doors and Get Out The Vote! https://t.co/UxkylIiiVU

Felíz Día de los Muertos Oklahoma! Today our Latino community came together to celebrate life remember their loved ones and share beautiful art and music. I was honored to be able to experience this rich tradition! https://t.co/UcLTsuW8x9

Ever since I was a Girl Scout I’ve been shaking things up. Take it from the people who know me the best! My lifelong friends Josh and Michelle talk about my history of doing things the Oklahoman way and getting the job done for our state. https://t.co/1F7kOG7fLP
Quick pitstop to thank all of our AMAZING volunteers on Team Horn! Join us anytime 8 AM to 8 PM at 3528 W Reno Ave now through Election Day to help us GET OUT THE VOTE!! https://t.co/6xkNkcUGLo

Life is hard right now and so many Oklahomans are anxious about their future. That’s why I’m committed to protecting health care access for those with pre-existing conditions and investing in our public schools so our kids can thrive. We will get through this – together. https://t.co/4tSevXL1b4
A big thank you to @CalleDosCinco for hosting us at their table today! Appreciate everything you do for the community!!

🎃 Trick or treat! Look how many creative young Oklahomans we have in our midst!! Thanks to Scissortail Park for putting on such an amazing and safe event for our kids and families. https://t.co/mejKyg3zpQ
We are not throwing away our shot!! If you haven’t yet vote today or Nov. 3rd! https://t.co/6AHjzD4eYm

Had an amazing time meeting and marching with voters at Souls to the Polls! The turnout at the Oklahoma County Election Board looks pretty darn good for the final day of early voting! If you haven’t voted yet and can’t make it today — make a plan to vote on November 3rd! https://t.co/YCd9vf3Nfc

Your vote is your voice! With the final day of early voting upon us and Election Day just three days away our campaign wants to make sure you’re able to exercise your right to vote. Give us a call if you have any trouble casting your ballot. https://t.co/GnWnQyLECx

Oklahomans deserve an actual plan on health care. I’m proud of my 25-point plan to reduce health care costs expand health care access and lower drug prices. We need a bipartisan path forward to give more Oklahomans access to affordable care. https://t.co/ErJUDcw2Sa

My opponent’s first problem is that all she has to say about tackling health care fits into eight sentences of buzzwords. Her second problem is that five of those sentences aren’t even hers. https://t.co/YY0EVyqiuN

I’ve never seen so many Oklahomans this excited to cast their ballots! Some first-timers some seasoned voters — but everyone ready to make their voices heard! Get out to vote Oklahoma! Last day of early voting is tomorrow. https://t.co/YPjyv0fiaj

Four days left!! So grateful to the folks at Fairview Baptist Church for all the work they’re putting in to help get out the vote! This is how we won in 2018 and this is how we’ll win again on Election Day! https://t.co/UyHJTRYasN
🙌 https://t.co/slgGQ4xWmW

Hot soup coming through!! Tonight I’m at Ebenezer Baptist Church helping to serve up a few meals for those without power. I’m always so proud of Oklahomans for coming together and taking care of one another. That’s what the Oklahoma Standard is all about! https://t.co/Gq1ox8HamH
Dropped off some food at Cox Convention Center for Oklahomans sheltering there. Stop by until 6 PM today for heat and supplies! https://t.co/FGqj47aPbf

Ice storm fallen trees and power outages haven’t stopped Team Horn! Thank you so much — I’m so grateful to each and every one of you for your unwavering support and crucial efforts in helping us win this race! 5 DAYS https://t.co/1lskMNp1Qu
Home sleet home... stay safe Oklahoma!   Please stay off the roads if you can and report outages to https://t.co/VX3AuF7beM! https://t.co/w1Z467xfuT

I’m sure you’ve heard a lot about me and a lot of it simply isn’t true. I always put Oklahoma first whether I’m voting to invest in public schools increase access to affordable health care or protect local jobs. These things matter and it’s what I’ll always fight for. https://t.co/T4ib90Z9m9

Thank you to all the Oklahoma educators who braved the cold to join me yesterday! I was proud to stand with you all at the State Capitol in 2018 and I’m honored to have you stand with me in this campaign.   I’ll never stop fighting for our public schools in Congress. https://t.co/0mK1PAGksZ

Had a great time at Pull Up and Praise at the State Capitol with Fifth Street Baptist Church yesterday! Busy weekend on the campaign trail and just EIGHT days left until Election Day! Single digits people!! https://t.co/KcmYOugRIq

As COVID hospitalizations hit record highs voters deserve to know where candidates stand on health care. Today I’m calling on @StephanieBice to release the details of her plan. Abolishing the ACA in the middle of a pandemic isn’t a plan – it’s a disaster. https://t.co/zCbW7LinrI

🚨Today I received the endorsements of @OKEA Oklahoma AFT and @okc_aft! 🚨  I will always be a champion for public education. It’s an investment in our children our families and our future. I’m honored to have the support of our educators in my fight for Oklahoma. https://t.co/P45ntTCdmG

I voted against my party’s $3 trillion spending bill and I opposed Medicare For All because you can’t spend your way out of problems and reckless spending is not right for Oklahoma families. I’ll always put Oklahomans first. https://t.co/RIIkVhMQ96
how it started:                                        how it's going: https://t.co/eh4PYhAbIE
Thank you to Rock The Native Vote for hosting such an amazing get out the vote event! Oklahoma cast your ballot!! https://t.co/4bylncWpzg
We still have work to do and I stand committed to working with Tribal Nations to defend their tribal sovereignty.

One of my proudest moments in Congress during my first term was passing the Violence Against Women Reauthorization Act which strengthened tribal jurisdiction and helped to address the epidemic of violence against Native women.
Had a great time speaking with tribal leaders and members at the Unite the People Powwow last night! What a great event! https://t.co/ODWuxlKB5C

Yesterday I announced my 25-Point Health Care Plan and Clayton joined me to speak. His daughter has Type 1 Diabetes and relies on the Affordable Care Act for access to insulin. His words are a reminder of the very real stakes of health care policy for Oklahoma families. https://t.co/lv9qwTIvlQ

I show up for Oklahoma even when the road gets bumpy. I’ll always work to protect and expand health care fight for public dollars to go to public schools and stand up to my party when it counts. I’ll never take the easy road because I work for you. https://t.co/ARpH0oEtAb

Doing what’s right for Oklahoma often means standing up to party leadership. Whether I’m fighting for our public schools or speaking out for our energy industry I’ll always take a thoughtful bipartisan approach that puts Oklahoma first.  https://t.co/MIb4ctrcz3

Oklahoma is also a wind and solar state. We rank third in the nation for wind energy. Diversity is important to our energy industry and to our economy as a whole. An all-of-the-above energy approach is essential.

At the same time we can and must address climate change. Here in OK we know the value of conservation: my great grandparents packed up their lives to flee the Dust Bowl. I'm proud to have an A rating from LCV. Supporting the environment doesn't mean all-or-nothing solutions.

Here’s one of the places Biden and I disagree. We must stand up for our oil and gas industry. We need an all-of-the-above energy approach that’s consumer friendly values energy independence and protects OK jobs. I'll keep fighting for that in Congress. https://t.co/9fIaZ8pyY1

In the midst of a pandemic Oklahomans deserve to know the details of candidate plans on health care.  I’m releasing my 25-Point Health Care Plan to reduce premiums lower drug costs and increase access to care. People are tired of political rhetoric – they deserve a real plan. https://t.co/BAPBkCIYMS
I know we owe a debt to our men and women in uniform who have faithfully served and I’ll never stop fighting for them.  If you’re a veteran join Team Horn today: https://t.co/Lg6S9MnOGl

One of my favorite moments during my first term in Congress was awarding one of Oklahoma City’s own WWII veterans a long overdue Victory Medal. I’m so proud to have Mr. McCreery’s support in this election. https://t.co/xfxgKWzCSJ
🔥 13 days and Team Horn has the momentum! 🔥  Our campaign to invest in public schools lower health care costs and get the job done for Oklahoma is winning. Let’s keep it up!  https://t.co/lzX9kuloFa

Thank you to @LovesTravelStop for your support and for the vital role you play in our state’s economy! Your growth from a small family business to an employer of 1500 Oklahomans and 27000 nationwide is an inspiration. I’m thrilled I was able to help out during this crisis. https://t.co/u1owl6yeMF

Tonight’s your last chance to hear where my opponent and I stand on the critical issues facing our communities! Fact Check: There's only one candidate in this race who's cut police funding. It's @StephanieBice. I've led the way on bipartisan legislation to increase funding to train law enforcement on recognizing deescalating and responding to people in mental health crisis. https://t.co/fTdqClIjCA

Lying again. I’ve always opposed Medicare for All despite what my opponent and dark money groups say. I believe we need to strengthen the Affordable Care Act and expand Medicaid not eliminate private insurance. #OK05Debate https://t.co/rnF5fhCYAk

I’m a representative for ALL Oklahomans regardless of party. That’s why I’ve hosted a record number of town halls during my first term. I’m beholden to Oklahomans and Oklahomans alone. I have and will continue to make your voice heard in Washington. #OK05Debate https://t.co/mMeFoF5tnL
Let’s set the record straight. #OK05Debate https://t.co/mWQeCTJt2H

My opponent talks a big talk about funding the police but voted to cut $9 million from public safety in this year’s budget. They even had to cancel Trooper Academy in OK. We need action to improve police training not lip service. #OK05Debate  https://t.co/5nKHKq1X7v

1 in 10 calls for police response involve a person with mental illness.  1 in 4 people killed by police live with mental illness.   That’s why I led a bipartisan bill to train police to recognize deescalate and properly respond to people in mental health crisis. #OK05Debate https://t.co/Zuoq4o2ZWY
My opponent likes to lie about the For the People Act (H.R.1). Here’s what it actually does: @stopbigmoney #RunningOnReform #ForThePeople #NoCorporatePAC https://t.co/fq9uqCxChT

The same old political talking points aren’t going to cut it this election. Facts are facts: I voted against the Speaker more than 99 percent of other members of my party in the House.   I’m never afraid to stand up for Oklahoma.  #OK05Debate

I supported Mayor Holt and the City Council when they took action to implement a mask ordinance -- because it saves lives. Living up to the Oklahoma standard means helping our neighbors and our community. Right now that means wearing a mask while out in public. #OK05Debate https://t.co/icXwBLW7eh

I supported the CARES Act to create the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) to help our small businesses and when funds ran out I led the charge to restore it urging both parties to stop using PPP as a political football. #OK05Debate https://t.co/dRShF8zRQS
More than 33000 ballots have already been counted in Oklahoma County! Here's what that process looks like:  https://t.co/wZLekcsOon

3 key reminders for voters in OK:  1. Mail your ballot by Oct. 27 to ensure on time arrival. Ballot must be RECEIVED by 7 PM on Election Day  2. Sign your affidavit EVEN IF you don't use a notary  3. If you use a copy of an ID make sure it doesn't expire before or on Nov. 3rd

Health insurance access is worth fighting for. Protections for people with pre-existing conditions are worth fighting for. The hundreds of thousands of Oklahomans who rely on the Affordable Care Act are worth fighting for. Let’s improve our health care system not throw it away.

What if you get in a car accident? Would a savings account cover your trip to the emergency room? Or if you can’t afford insulin and slip into a diabetic coma - would your health savings account cover your hospital stay?  Ask most middle-class Oklahoma families. The answer is no.

Today my opponent said we should abolish the ACA and replace health insurance with health savings accounts. That’s not a plan- that’s a disaster.  The average cost of a COVID hospital stay with no insurance is $73k. A health savings account won’t even come close to covering that https://t.co/abiOhr3wno

The saddest part of the reports surrounding Epic is that the biggest victims are our school children. When for-profit organizations take public school dollars to line their own pockets our kids suffer. https://t.co/tC6uekZ5ti

We cannot sell out Medicaid to private insurance companies. 200000 Oklahomans are counting on Medicaid expansion for access to affordable care and our voters supported it this year! @GovStitt: stop playing politics with health care for Oklahomans. https://t.co/iZ6XGpURD9

NOTICE: The second debate for #OK05 has been postponed to this Wednesday October 14th. You can stream it at 9 p.m. on https://t.co/ckKJr4WM1Q. Tune in to hear more about my fight for public education quality affordable healthcare and economic opportunity for all Oklahomans! https://t.co/bJTh6vs9IR
I will always work to protect tribal sovereignty and with tribal local and national leaders support the needs of Indian Country.

Join Team Horn virtually and in-person tomorrow!  Learn more and sign up here ⬇️  Get Out The Vote Virtual Rally: https://t.co/Z5LFvAnQiD Meet Up with Kendra: https://t.co/Jh77zmBrWE  25 days remain until Election Day -- let’s make ‘em count! https://t.co/D2aPeqbsik

We owe a debt to the men and women in uniform who faithfully serve our country. You cannot improve veterans services by cutting funding and hoping the private sector will pick up the slack. We have to uphold our end of the bargain. #OK05Debate https://t.co/Cd5E5mqnNf

No one should be afraid to call the police because of the color of their skin. That’s why I voted to pass the Justice in Policing Act to  - Create nationwide police misconduct registry - Ban chokeholds - Create nationwide police misconduct registry  #OK05Debate https://t.co/uP9Y222k6T
My grocery list is more detailed than your health care plan #OK05Debate

We’re in a pandemic. Overturning the Affordable Care Act would be a disaster -- it would rob hundreds of thousands of Oklahomans of their insurance and drive prices up. We need to strengthen our health care system not rip the rug out from under patients. #OK05Debate

I’m not beholden to anyone except the people of Oklahoma. We need someone who’s going to stand up to their party where it counts and that’s what I’ve done time and again. #OK05Debate https://t.co/lk2XjrByqW

We’re still in a crisis and Oklahomans need help. That’s why I’m working with 25 republicans and 25 democrats to find a bipartisan path forward to the next stimulus package and deliver relief to our communities in need. #OK05Debate

@StevesWPolitics Our campaign feels that access to a photocopier is as difficult as a notary and both are much more restrictive than an affidavit signed under the penalty of perjury.  But we're here doing our best to help people vote. You need notaries we've got notaries. Safe and fast!

@StevesWPolitics After essentially overturning the decision in the last days of session the legislature passed a law that would allow a photocopy of specific forms of identification similar to what you would need at the poll.  Acceptable example of ID's are included in mail ballot instructions.

@StevesWPolitics Complicated: The State Supreme Court did rule that an affidavit signed by the voter under the penalty of perjury would suffice (under Oklahoma law a notary and an affidavit are essentially the same).  The state legislature then made moves to overturn that decision.
Need your ballot notarized? Don't forget to stop by one of our drive-thru notary locations this weekend (we've got yard signs there too!)  https://t.co/9qDycb4X2J
